analysis of brain lesions 脑病损分析

Ability Based on Long Experience 基于长期经验的能力

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"有能力的，能干的"之意。
means: able ：最常用词，多用于褒义，着重指多方面的，经常性的，或潜在性的能力。有时也指高超、非凡的能力。
capable ：语气弱于able，指有能力、有潜力或有条件做某事，常与of连用。
competent ：强调具有能胜任某项工作的足够技能或其它所需的条件。

sentence.Network_en: Chantal was lucky to be able to salvage her career.
sentence.Network_cn: 尚塔尔能保住她的事业算是走了运。

sentence.Network_en: The RAF recognized him as an out-standingly able engineer.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国皇家空军表彰他是一名非常能干的机械师。

sentence.Network_en: Anton was able to transfer from Lavine's to an American company.
sentence.Network_cn: 安东成功地从拉文调到了一家美国公司.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (also in the sense 'easy to use, suitable'): from Old French hable, from Latin habilis 'handy', from habere 'to hold'

encyclopedia.content: able是一个英文单词。主要释义如下做形容词 a. 1.能，可，会[F][+to-v] I am afraid I won't be able to visit you on Saturday. 恐怕我无法在星期六来拜访您了。 2.有能力的；能干的He is an able lawyer. 他是一位能干的律师。 做后缀 suf. -able 构成形容词 1.表示"能。..的","可以。..的",如：usable, excusable 2.表示"适于。..的","有。..特性的",如：eatable, marketable 3.表示&

entry.tran: （因具有品质或技能）能做到…的
entry.def: If you are able to do something, you have skills or qualities which make it possible for you to do it.

example.ex: The older child should be able to prepare a simple meal...
example.tran: 那个年纪稍大的孩子应当会做一顿简单的饭菜。

example.ex: The company say they're able to keep pricing competitive...
example.tran: 该公司说他们能够使定价保持竞争力。

entry.tran: （因有足够的自由、权力、时间、财力等而）可以…的，能够…的
entry.def: If you are able to do something, you have enough freedom, power, time, or money to do it.

example.ex: You'll be able to read in peace...
Have you been able to have any kind of contact?...

entry.tran: 聪明能干的；能力出众的
entry.def: Someone who is able is very clever or very good at doing something.

example.ex: ...one of the brightest and ablest members of the government...
example.tran: 政府里最聪明能干的成员之一

example.ex: They are bright, intelligent, able and confident.
example.tran: 他们聪明又智慧，能干又自信。

means.word_mean: 1. (usually followed by `to') having the necessary means or skill or know-how or authority to do something;

sentences.sentence: "she was able to program her computer"
"we were at last able to buy a car"
"able to get a grant for the project"

means.word_mean: 2. have the skills and qualifications to do things well;

sentences.sentence: "children as young as 14 can be extremely capable and dependable"

means.word_mean: 3. having inherent physical or mental ability or capacity;

sentences.sentence: "human beings are able to walk on two feet"
"Superman is able to leap tall buildings"
"every able-bodied young man served in the army"

list.explanation: (常用于否定句)有能力完成某事的

example.en: He is not able to cut his responsibilities like we thought.
example.zh: 如我们所料，他没有能力完成他的职责。

example.en: Do you think you're able to cut it?
example.zh: 你觉得你能完成这亊吗？

slang.tokens: not able to hold a candle to

example.en: The cake from the bakery is not able to hold a candle to the one that Grandmonther made.
example.zh: 店里买来的蛋糕跟奶奶做的无法相比。

auth_sentence.content: You showed what you were able to do today.
auth_sentence.res_content: You showed what you were able to do today.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You showed what you were able to do today.

auth_sentence.content: He was depressed at not being able to play.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was depressed at not being able to play.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was depressed at not being able to play.

auth_sentence.content: Would the main guest be able to join us?
auth_sentence.res_content: Would the main guest be able to join us?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Would the main guest be able to join us?

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有[能力、时间、知识等]做某事,有本事的
stems_affixes.word_buile: abl能力→adj.有[能力、时间、知识等]做某事,有本事的
un无+able有能力的→adj.不能的, 不会的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使残废, 使失去能力, 丧失能力
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis去掉+able有能力的→v.使残废, 使失去能力, 丧失能力

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使能够, 授予权利或方法
stems_affixes.word_buile: en使……+able有能力的→v.使能够, 授予权利或方法

Sentence.sentence: She's afraid she won't be able to attend your class this afternoon though.
Furthermore, students will be able to purchase sections of the text instead of buying the whole thing, with individual chapters costing as little as $
Few people are able to resist alcohol's temptations.

sentences.en: Most children are able to walk before they are able to talk.
sentences.cn: 多数孩子在会说话前就会走路。

sentences.en: The patient was soon able to sit up.
sentences.cn: 病人很快就能坐起来了。

means.word_mean: 有才干的, 有本事的

sentences.en: He was acknowledged as an able statesman.
sentences.cn: 他被公认为是个有才干的政治家。

sentences.en: The general impression at the studio was that he was able.
sentences.cn: 在这个画室获得的总的印象是他很有才能。

jushi.chinese: 她是一位有才干的领导。

jushi.english: Brooks is the most able student in the class.
jushi.chinese: 布鲁克斯是班上最有才华的学生。

jushi.english: There are many able students in our institute.
jushi.chinese: 我们学校有许多有才华的学生。
